title: Christine McVie - In the Meantime (2004)
description:
&#039;In the Meantime&#039; is a wonderful album which sees the welcome return of Fleetwood Mac&#039;s former keyboardist/singer-songwriter Christine McVie. The tracks are in keeping with her proven record of lyrical beauty and simplicity, with a strong rhythm section and funky keyboards. Some songs are reminiscent of Fleetwood Mac in its heyday, particularly &#039;You Are&#039; and &#039;Friend&#039;. This will no doubt please Mac fans who lamented McVie&#039;s absence from the band&#039;s 2003 album &#039;Say You Will&#039;. There is a variety of styles over the album, though, partly acknowledging the singer&#039;s blues roots and including writing contributions from a number of others, among whom are McVie&#039;s nephew Dan Perfect and former Mac guitarist Billy Burnette. Overall, this album will satisfy fans of Christine McVie&#039;s excellent ear for a catchy tune, and allow them once again to hear the beauty of her ageless honeyed vocals.

(Amazon review).sm
